pageContext.claim: “We can have it totally finished in one week [eliminating ISIS in Syria]. I said: ‘One week? I was told two years. One week?’ ‘That's right, sir.’ … I said, ‘Why didn't my other generals tell me that?’ … ‘They come in from Washington, sir. We have to take orders. You're the first one to ask us our opinion.’”
pageContext.analysis: Trump often describes conversations in which he is the first to think of something pertaining to some huge issue in world affairs. But it's unlikely that U.S. generals based in Washington are making policy decisions without consulting commanders in the field. And the decimation of Islamic State forces in Syria has been a gradual one stretching back to the Obama administration.
